00032 #ifndef HEALPIX_MAP_H
00033 #define HEALPIX_MAP_H
00034 
00035 #include "arr.h"
00036 #include "healpix_base.h"
00037 
00038 //! Healpix value representing "undefined"
00039 const double Healpix_undef=-1.6375e30;
00040 
00041 /*! A HEALPix map of a given datatype */
00042 template<typename T> class Healpix_Map: public Healpix_Base
00043   {
00044   private:
00045     arr<T> map;
00046 
00047   public:
00048     /*! Constructs an unallocated map. */
00049     Healpix_Map () {}
00050     /*! Constructs a map with a given \a order and the ordering
00051         scheme \a scheme. */
00052     Healpix_Map (int order, Healpix_Ordering_Scheme scheme)
00053       : Healpix_Base (order, scheme), map(npix_) {}
00054     /*! Constructs a map with a given \a nside and the ordering
00055         scheme \a scheme. */
00056     Healpix_Map (int nside, Healpix_Ordering_Scheme scheme, const nside_dummy)
00057       : Healpix_Base (nside, scheme, SET_NSIDE), map(npix_) {}
00058     /*! Constructs a map from the contents of \a data and sets the ordering
00059         scheme to \a Scheme. The size of \a data must be a valid HEALPix
00060         map size. */
00061     Healpix_Map (const arr<T> &data, Healpix_Ordering_Scheme scheme)
00062       : Healpix_Base (npix2nside(data.size()), scheme, SET_NSIDE), map(data) {}
00063 
00064     /*! Deletes the old map, creates a map from the contents of \a data and
00065         sets the ordering scheme to \a scheme. The size of \a data must be a
00066         valid HEALPix map size.
00067         \note On exit, \a data is zero-sized! */
00068     void Set (arr<T> &data, Healpix_Ordering_Scheme scheme)
00069       {
00070       Healpix_Base::SetNside(npix2nside (data.size()), scheme);
00071       map.transfer(data);
00072       }
00073 
00074     /*! Deletes the old map and creates a new map  with a given \a order
00075         and the ordering scheme \a scheme. */
00076     void Set (int order, Healpix_Ordering_Scheme scheme)
00077       {
00078       Healpix_Base::Set(order, scheme);
00079       map.alloc(npix_);
00080       }
00081     /*! Deletes the old map and creates a new map  with a given \a nside
00082         and the ordering scheme \a scheme. */
00083     void SetNside (int nside, Healpix_Ordering_Scheme scheme)
00084       {
00085       Healpix_Base::SetNside(nside, scheme);
00086       map.alloc(npix_);
00087       }
00088 
00089     /*! Fills the map with \a val. */
00090     void fill (const T &val)
00091       { map.fill(val); }
00092 
00093     /*! Imports the map \a orig into the current map, adjusting the
00094         ordering scheme. \a orig must have the same resolution as the
00095         current map. */
00096     void Import_nograde (const Healpix_Map<T> &orig)
00097       {
00098       planck_assert (nside_==orig.nside_,
00099         "Import_nograde: maps have different nside");
00100       if (orig.scheme_ == scheme_)
00101         for (int m=0; m<npix_; ++m) map[m] = orig.map[m];
00102       else
00103         {
00104         swapfunc swapper = (scheme_ == NEST) ?
00105           &Healpix_Base::ring2nest : &Healpix_Base::nest2ring;
00106 #pragma omp parallel
00107 {
00108         int m;
00109 #pragma omp for schedule (dynamic,5000)
00110         for (m=0; m<npix_; ++m) map[(this->*swapper)(m)] = orig.map[m];
00111 }
00112         }
00113       }
00114 
00115     /*! Imports the map \a orig into the current map, adjusting the
00116         ordering scheme and the map resolution. \a orig must have higher
00117         resolution than the current map. */
00118     void Import_upgrade (const Healpix_Map<T> &orig)
00119       {
00120       planck_assert(nside_>orig.nside_,"Import_upgrade: this is no upgrade");
00121       int fact = nside_/orig.nside_;
00122       planck_assert (nside_==orig.nside_*fact,
00123         "the larger Nside must be a multiple of the smaller one");
00124       pix2xyf to_xyf = (orig.scheme_==RING) ?
00125         &Healpix_Map::ring2xyf : &Healpix_Map::nest2xyf;
00126       xyf2pix from_xyf = (scheme_==RING) ?
00127         &Healpix_Map::xyf2ring : &Healpix_Map::xyf2nest;
00128 
00129 #pragma omp parallel
00130 {
00131       int m;
00132 #pragma omp for schedule (dynamic,5000)
00133       for (m=0; m<orig.npix_; ++m)
00134         {
00135         int x,y,f;
00136         (orig.*to_xyf)(m,x,y,f);
00137         for (int j=fact*y; j<fact*(y+1); ++j)
00138           for (int i=fact*x; i<fact*(x+1); ++i)
00139             {
00140             int mypix = (this->*from_xyf)(i,j,f);
00141             map[mypix] = orig.map[m];
00142             }
00143         }
00144 }
00145       }
00146 
00147     /*! Imports the map \a orig into the current map, adjusting the
00148         ordering scheme and the map resolution. \a orig must have higher
00149         resolution than the current map.
00150         \a pessimistic determines whether or not
00151         pixels are set to \a Healpix_undef when not all of the corresponding
00152         high-resolution pixels are defined.
00153 
00154         This method is instantiated for \a float and \a double only. */
00155     void Import_degrade (const Healpix_Map<T> &orig, bool pessimistic=false);
00156 
00157     /*! Imports the map \a orig into the current map, adjusting the
00158         ordering scheme and the map resolution if necessary.
00159         When downgrading, \a pessimistic determines whether or not
00160         pixels are set to \a Healpix_undef when not all of the corresponding
00161         high-resolution pixels are defined.
00162 
00163         This method is instantiated for \a float and \a double only. */
00164     void Import (const Healpix_Map<T> &orig, bool pessimistic=false)
00165       {
00166       if (orig.nside_ == nside_) // no up/degrading
00167         Import_nograde(orig);
00168       else if (orig.nside_ < nside_) // upgrading
00169         Import_upgrade(orig);
00170       else
00171         Import_degrade(orig,pessimistic);
00172       }
00173 
00174     /*! Returns a constant reference to the pixel with the number \a pix. */
00175     const T &operator[] (int pix) const { return map[pix]; }
00176     /*! Returns a reference to the pixel with the number \a pix. */
00177     T &operator[] (int pix) { return map[pix]; }
00178 
00179     /*! Swaps the map ordering from RING to NEST and vice versa.
00180         This is done in-place (i.e. with negligible space overhead). */
00181     void swap_scheme()
00182       {
00183       static const int clen[] = { 0,7,5,4,12,10,13,18,14,19,18,17,27,21 };
00184       static const int cycle[][30] = {
00185         { },
00186         { 0,1,8,12,16,21,40 },
00187         { 0,1,2,40,114 },
00188         { 0,4,160,263 },
00189         { 0,4,30,49,51,87,526,1027,1105,1387,1807,2637 },
00190         { 0,8,10,18,39,74,146,307,452,4737 },
00191         { 0,1,2,7,9,17,80,410,1526,1921,32859,33566,38931 },
00192         { 0,5,6,10,12,24,27,95,372,494,924,1409,3492,4248,9137,66043,103369,
00193           156899 },
00194         { 0,1,2,3,4,45,125,351,697,24337,102940,266194,341855,419857 },
00195         { 0,1,2,3,9,16,1705,2082,2126,8177,12753,15410,52642,80493,83235,
00196           88387,99444,1675361,2495125 },
00197         { 0,2,6,8,9,11,20,50,93,152,183,2137,13671,44794,486954,741908,
00198           4803258,5692573 },
00199         { 0,1,5,6,44,53,470,2847,3433,4906,13654,14710,400447,1797382,
00200           2744492,18775974,23541521 },
00201         { 0,4,9,10,16,33,83,117,318,451,5759,10015,128975,171834,211256,
00202           347608,1278690,2154097,2590798,3427694,5581717,21012301,27023976,
00203           72522811,95032729,139166747,171822389 },
00204         { 0,5,10,267,344,363,2968,3159,9083,18437,76602,147614,1246902,
00205           1593138,2035574,6529391,9511830,11340287,29565945,281666026,
00206           677946848 } };
00207 
00208       swapfunc swapper = (scheme_ == NEST) ?
00209         &Healpix_Base::ring2nest : &Healpix_Base::nest2ring;
00210 
00211       planck_assert (order_>=0, "swap_scheme(): need hierarchical map");
00212 
00213       for (int m=0; m<clen[order_]; ++m)
00214         {
00215         int istart = cycle[order_][m];
00216 
00217         T pixbuf = map[istart];
00218         int iold = istart, inew = (this->*swapper)(istart);
00219         while (inew != istart)
00220           {
00221           map[iold] = map[inew];
00222           iold = inew;
00223           inew = (this->*swapper)(inew);
00224           }
00225         map[iold] = pixbuf;
00226         }
00227       scheme_ = (scheme_==RING) ? NEST : RING;
00228       }
00229 
00230     /*! performs the actual interpolation using \a pix and \a wgt. */
00231     T interpolation (const fix_arr<int,4> &pix,
00232       const fix_arr<double,4> &wgt) const
00233       {
00234       return T(map[pix[0]]*wgt[0] + map[pix[1]]*wgt[1]
00235              + map[pix[2]]*wgt[2] + map[pix[3]]*wgt[3]);
00236       }
00237     /*! Returns the interpolated map value at \a ptg */
00238     T interpolated_value (const pointing &ptg) const
00239       {
00240       fix_arr<int,4> pix;
00241       fix_arr<double,4> wgt;
00242       get_interpol (ptg, pix, wgt);
00243       return interpolation (pix, wgt);
00244       }
00245 
00246     /*! Returns a constant reference to the map data. */
00247     const arr<T> &Map() const { return map; }
00248 
00249     /*! Returns the minimum and maximum value of the map in
00250         \a Min and \a Max.
00251 
00252         This method is instantiated for \a float and \a double only. */
00253     void minmax (T &Min, T &Max) const;
00254 
00255     /*! Swaps the contents of two Healpix_Map objects. */
00256     void swap (Healpix_Map &other)
00257       {
00258       Healpix_Base::swap(other);
00259       map.swap(other.map);
00260       }
00261 
00262     /*! Returns the average of all defined map pixels. */
00263     double average() const
00264       {
00265       double avg=0;
00266       int pix=0;
00267       for (int m=0; m<npix_; ++m)
00268         if (!approx<double>(map[m],Healpix_undef))
00269           { ++pix; avg+=map[m]; }
00270       return avg/pix;
00271       }
00272 
00273     /*! Adds \a val to all defined map pixels. */
00274     void Add (T val)
00275       {
00276       for (int m=0; m<npix_; ++m)
00277         if (!approx<double>(map[m],Healpix_undef))
00278           { map[m]+=val; }
00279       }
00280 
00281     /*! Multiplies all defined map pixels by \a val. */
00282     void Scale (T val)
00283       {
00284       for (int m=0; m<npix_; ++m)
00285         if (!approx<double>(map[m],Healpix_undef))
00286           { map[m]*=val; }
00287       }
00288 
00289     /*! Returns the root mean square of the map, not counting undefined
00290         pixels. */
00291     double rms() const
00292       {
00293       using namespace std;
00294 
00295       double result=0;
00296       int pix=0;
00297       for (int m=0; m<npix_; ++m)
00298         if (!approx<double>(map[m],Healpix_undef))
00299           { ++pix; result+=map[m]*map[m]; }
00300       return sqrt(result/pix);
00301       }
00302     /*! Returns the maximum absolute value in the map, ignoring undefined
00303         pixels. */
00304     T absmax() const
00305       {
00306       using namespace std;
00307 
00308       T result=0;
00309       for (int m=0; m<npix_; ++m)
00310         if (!approx<double>(map[m],Healpix_undef))
00311           { result = max(result,abs(map[m])); }
00312       return result;
00313       }
00314   };
00315 
00316 #endif
